hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: good material thanks pescience protein white chocolate mint I've worked as either a journalist, editor or columnist for 15 years and I write about art, investing, and where those two worlds collide. Words I've put in a row have appeared in the Financial Times, where I'm a long-standing contributor, The Economist and The Times of London, among others. My articles cover everything from art investment funds and pension trusts for artists to art investment vacations, but also plenty of straight investment topics such as exchange-traded funds and municipal bond funds. I also write about the investment market for other collectibles such as wine, photography, vintage cars, jewelry and furniture. I enjoy telling the stories of avid collectors, like the guy who spent 6 years and 4000 hours restoring the Ferrari 250GT Lusso Berlinetta that once belonged to Steve McQueen. I've even written about racehorse syndicates. Strangely enough, those aren't great investments. I also write about artists, exhibitions and other more general art topics. Follow me on twitter.com/KathrynTully or find me on Facebook at facebook.com/forbespriceless.
